article.headline: James Madison 59, Georgia State 52
article.story: ATLANTA (AP) -- Terrance Carter scored 20 points and grabbed nine rebounds and Juwann James had a double-double to help James Madison beat Georgia State 59-52 on Saturday night. The Dukes (6-12, 3-5 Coloniel Athletic Association) took a 43-34 lead with 10:58 left in the second half. But Georgia State cut the lead to three on 3-pointers from Ron Larris and Ryan McBride. James Madison went up 57-51 with 17.9 seconds left. Georgia State had a chance to close within two points with three seconds remaining, but they couldn't on late missed free throws. Pierre Curtis scored 11 points and had four steals, while James had 10 points and 10 rebounds for the Dukes. Georgia State was led by Lane Perique's 16 points. Leonard Mendez scored 14 points and Norman Mitchell added 10 in the loss.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
